Package com.atakmap.map.layer.raster.tilematrix

Interface TileMatrix

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TileClient, TileContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:

    public interface TileMatrix
extends Disposable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Envelope getBounds()
      Returns the minimum bounding box of the data containing region per the native spatial reference of the content.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the tiled content.
      double getOriginX()
      Returns the x-component of the tile matrix origin (upper-left) in the native spatial reference of the content.
      double getOriginY()
      Returns the y-component of the tile matrix origin (upper-left) in the native spatial reference of the content.
      int getSRID()
      Returns the Spatial Reference ID associated with the tiled content.
      android.graphics.Bitmap getTile​(int zoom, int x, int y, java.lang.Throwable[] error)
      Returns the tile for the specified zoom level, tile row and tile column as a decoded Bitmap.
      byte[] getTileData​(int zoom, int x, int y, java.lang.Throwable[] error)
      Returns the tile data for the specified zoom level, tile row and tile column.
      TileMatrix.ZoomLevel[] getZoomLevel()
      Returns the definition of the zoom levels associated with the content.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the tiled content.
        Returns:
        The name of the tilted content.

      • getSRID

        int getSRID()
        Returns the Spatial Reference ID associated with the tiled content. EPSG code values shall be used.
        Returns:
        The Spatial Reference ID associated with the tiled content.

      • getZoomLevel

        TileMatrix.ZoomLevel[] getZoomLevel()
        Returns the definition of the zoom levels associated with the content.
        Returns:
        The definition of the zoom levels associated with the content.

      • getOriginX

        double getOriginX()
        Returns the x-component of the tile matrix origin (upper-left) in the native spatial reference of the content.
        Returns:
        The x-component of the tile matrix origin (upper-left) in the native spatial reference of the content.

      • getOriginY

        double getOriginY()
        Returns the y-component of the tile matrix origin (upper-left) in the native spatial reference of the content.
        Returns:
        The y-component of the tile matrix origin (upper-left) in the native spatial reference of the content.

      • getTile

        android.graphics.Bitmap getTile​(int zoom,
                                int x,
                                int y,
                                java.lang.Throwable[] error)
        Returns the tile for the specified zoom level, tile row and tile column as a decoded Bitmap.
        Parameters:
        zoom - The zoom level
        x - The tile column
        y - The tile row
        error - If non-null, returns the error that occurred when trying to obtain and decode the tile. This will be used for informational purposes only; implementations are not required to return a value.
        Returns:
        The decoded tile for the specified zoom, tile row and tile column, or null if there is no tile available or tile decode failed.

      • getTileData

        byte[] getTileData​(int zoom,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   java.lang.Throwable[] error)
        Returns the tile data for the specified zoom level, tile row and tile column.
        Parameters:
        zoom - The zoom level
        x - The tile column
        y - The tile row
        error - If non-null, returns the error that occurred when trying to obtain and decode the tile. This will be used for informational purposes only; implementations are not required to return a value.
        Returns:
        The tile data for the specified zoom, tile row and tile column, or null if there is no tile available.

      • getBounds

        Envelope getBounds()
        Returns the minimum bounding box of the data containing region per the native spatial reference of the content.

        Note that the returned value may not snap to the tile grid.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        #getSpatialReferenceId()
